newsitem.title: USA: Intuit to sell unit to Broderbund.
newsitem.headline: Intuit to sell unit to Broderbund.

text.p: Intuit Inc. said Thursday it agreed to sell its Parsons Technology unit, which writes art and advice software to consumers, to Broderbund Software Inc. for an undisclosed sum.
The transaction will help Intuit, publisher of the Quicken electronic checkbook program, focus on its personal finance and tax software, the companies said in a statement.
Meanwhile, Broderbund, one of the biggest sellers of educational software, will expand its line of products for families, the companies said.
Intuit, based in Mountain View, Calif., bought Parsons in Sept. 1994 for about $67.3 million in cash and stock. Parsons' products include Print Shop, Family Lawyer and Family Tree Maker.
Parsons also specializes in selling its products directly to consumers through a mail order operation. Broderbund said it will use that expertise in its own business.
As part of the proposed transaction, Intuit will keep Parsons' tax products, the companies said.
